intro: Xylothamia truncata, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and linear, often succulent leaves. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in dry conditions. Its bark is thick and corky, providing protection against drought and herbivory. Xylothamia truncata is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in some regions for its anti-inflammatory and antiseptic qualities.
